critique: This document pertains to internal administrative procedures within the civil service. It modifies Section 6 of Civil Service Rule X, specifically concerning transfers within the classified service. The changes broaden the scope of permissible transfers without requiring commission certificates, allowing them within the same branch of a department or office, and among military staff departments. The document does not directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most axes should be scored as neutral. The change seems to slightly increase the flexibility of federal departments, so I will give a +1 to federalism.
